closely the order that was issued by the
by judge Donnelly in the Brooklyn

enacts laws or executive orders are
unconstitutional and illegal the courts
are there to defend everyone's rights so
I just went to Terminal four and there's
sort of a hub there of attorneys who are
volunteering to work on this issue and
attorneys reporting and all day long
lawyers from a lot of different
backgrounds you know that court-ordered
immigration officials not to deport
anybody with valid visa including a
green card or other visa who arrived in
the country we did not have information
coming from the government about who was
being detained so our main task was to
try to find out we were just canvassing
people walking off the plane and we
located the family of one of those
people
he was the Yemeni he is a green card
holder that resided in the Bronx he had
contacted them as he was getting on the
flight in Doha and they might have
landed about an hour and a half earlier
and they've been unable to reach him at
all so we prepared a habeas corpus
petition so we didn't know whether he
would be indefinitely detained we didn't
know whether he would be deported as the
attorney was going to file it was
reviewing it the individual that it was
prepared for was released from detention
and came out and joined his family and
you know their entire life is here there
you know they have bank accounts here
they maybe have a business here they
have children here this was not a
carefully designed executive order a lot
of weighty attorneys who are very
experienced in these matters have looked
at this and said this was done very
sloppily the executive order leaves
huge areas undefined and how how it
needs to be applied and nobody really
knows what to do
